intro: Triumfetta rhomboidea var. recifensis, commonly known as the Recifense triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has ovate to lanceolate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural and ecological studies.
